Method Detail

addArtificialIntelligence

void addArtificialIntelligence(IPlayerHooks usercode)

buyBlueprint

PlayerState buyBlueprint(UnitState unit,
                         Blueprint blueprint)
Allows the given unit to buy a desired blueprint

If successful, the returned player state will have the required blueprint added to its boughtBlueprints field.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Parameters:
unit - the unit buying the blueprint
blueprint - the desired blueprint
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

craftObject

PlayerState craftObject(UnitState unit,
                        CraftedObject target,
                        HashMap<CraftedObject,Integer> usedObjects,
                        HashMap<CraftedObject.BasicResourceType,Integer> usedResources)
Allows the given unit to craft the target object using the specified ingredients.

If successful, the target object will be added to the unit's carriedObjects field. Also, the unit performing the action will have the ingredient quantities subtracted from its carriedResources / carriedObjects field.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Parameters:
unit - the unit performing the crafting action
target - the artifact that is supposed to be built
usedObjects - the list of object ingredients, if any. The value of this parameter may be null if the target object is of a simple type
usedResources - the list of basic resource ingredients, if any. The value of this parameter may be null if the target object is of a complex type
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

dig

PlayerState dig(UnitState unit)
Allows the given unit to dig for resources in the current cell.

If successful, the UnitState of the unit performing the action will have its currentCellResources updated with the resources contained in the currentCell.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Parameters:
unit - the unit performing the digging operation
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

dropObjects

PlayerState dropObjects(UnitState unit,
                        HashMap<CraftedObject,Integer> unwantedObjects)
Allows the given unit to drop the specified quantities of crafted objects.

If successful, the UnitState of the unit performing the action will have the specified object quantities subtracted from its carriedObjects field.

The dropped artifacts will now become visible to other units that pass near the current cell

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Parameters:
unit - the unit executing the drop action
unwantedResources - the unwanted objects and their quantities
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

dropResources

PlayerState dropResources(UnitState unit,
                          HashMap<CraftedObject.BasicResourceType,Integer> unwantedResources)
Allows the given unit to drop the specified quantities of crafted objects.

If successful, the UnitState of the unit performing the action will have the specified object quantities subtracted from its carriedObjects field.

The dropped artifacts will now become visible to other units that pass near the current cell

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Parameters:
unit - the unit executing the drop action
unwantedResources - the unwanted objects and their quantities
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

getPlayerState

PlayerState getPlayerState()
Returns the current locally stored player state.

Returns:
the locally stored player state that is the result of the last performed transition

move

PlayerState move(UnitState unit,
                 Point2i newPosition)
Allows a unit to move to an adjacent cell.

If the transition is successful, the returned player state will have the specified unit moved to the required position.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Parameters:
unit - the unit to be moved
newPosition - - the movement target position
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

pickupObjects

PlayerState pickupObjects(UnitState unit,
                          HashMap<CraftedObject,Integer> desiredObjects)
Allows the given unit to drop the specified quantities of basic resources.

If successful, the UnitState of the unit performing the action will have the specified resource quantities subtracted from its carriedResources field.

The dropped resources will now become visible to other units that pass near the current cell

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Parameters:
unit - the unit executing the drop action
unwantedResources - the unwanted resources and their quantities
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

pickupResources

PlayerState pickupResources(UnitState unit,
                            HashMap<CraftedObject.BasicResourceType,Integer> desiredResources)
Allows the given unit to pick up the resources contained in the current cell.

If successful, the UnitState of the unit performing the action will have the specified resources added to its carriedResources field.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Parameters:
unit - the unit performing the operation
desiredResources - the desired resources and their quantity
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

placeTower

PlayerState placeTower(UnitState unit)
Allows the given unit to place a tower in its current position.

If successful, the tower will be placed in the current position of the builder unit. Also, the new tower will be added to the availableTowers field of the returned player state.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Parameters:
unit - the unit building the tower
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

requestState

PlayerState requestState()
Returns the server stored player state. It might be useful to call this method at the beginning of a turn since tower drains are always performed then. The method thus allows a player to get an update on the energy levels of his units and on the remaining strength of his towers right at the start of a round.

Returns:
the player state as seen by the server application at the moment of inquiry or null if the call is made outside the player's turn

scan

PlayerState scan(UnitState unit)
Allows the given unit to perform a scan operation which is centered at the current cell.

If successful, the UnitState of the unit performing the action will have its scannedResourceAttributes field updated with the scan attributes of the cells that fall within the scanners radius.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Parameters:
unit - the unit performing the scan
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.

sellObject

PlayerState sellObject(UnitState unit,
                       CraftedObject craftedObject,
                       Integer quantity)
Allows the given unit to sell the specified quantity of target artifacts.

If successful, the value of the target artifact will be added to the players's score. Also, the unit performing the action will have the specified quantity of target artifacts subtracted from its carriedObjects field.

In case of an error, the returned player state will not be different from the current one. It will also contain a TransitionResult which gives the reason for the failure.

Parameters:
unit - the unit performing the selling action
craftedObject - the target object to be sold
quantity - the number of target objects to be sold
Returns:
the new player state or null if the player attempts to move outside his turn.
